verses.text: 神的律例「以色列人哪，現在你們要聽我向來教訓你們遵行的律例和典章，使你們可以活著，可以進去得著耶和華你們列祖的 神賜給你們的地作產業。

words.note: The raised dot indicates reverence for God.
Often refers to divine laws.
Often refers to divine laws.
Often used with 律例 for comprehensive laws.
The covenant name of God in the Old Testament.
The raised dot indicates reverence for God.
Often refers to an ancestral inheritance or possession.

verses.text: 我吩咐你們的話，你們不可增加，也不可減少，好使你們遵守我吩咐你們的，就是耶和華你們的 神的命令。

words.note: The covenant name of God in the Old Testament.
The raised dot indicates reverence for God.

verses.text: 耶和華因巴力．毗珥的事所行的，你們都親眼看見了；所有跟隨巴力．毗珥的人，耶和華你們的 神都從你們中間消滅了。

words.note: The covenant name of God in the Old Testament.
A Moabite deity worshipped at Mount Peor.
Used to form a nominalized phrase, 'that which was done'.
A Moabite deity worshipped at Mount Peor.
The covenant name of God in the Old Testament.
The raised dot indicates reverence for God.

verses.text: 只有你們緊緊倚靠耶和華你們的 神的人，今日全都活著。

words.note: Repetition emphasizes closeness/firmness.
Often used in a religious context for trusting God.
The covenant name of God in the Old Testament.
The raised dot indicates reverence for God.

verses.text: 看哪，我照著耶和華我的 神吩咐我的，把律例和典章教訓你們，好讓你們在將要進去得為業的地上遵行。

words.note: An interjection to draw attention, common in biblical texts.
The covenant name of God in the Old Testament.
The raised dot indicates reverence for God.
Introduces the direct object before the verb.
Often refers to divine laws.
Often used with 律例 for comprehensive laws.
Refers to the act of taking something as an inheritance.

verses.text: 所以你們要謹守遵行，因為在萬民的眼中看來，這就是你們的智慧和聰明；他們一聽見這一切律例，就必定說：『這大國的人真是有智慧，有聰明啊。』

breakdown.m: by means of, in order to

words.note: Often used in Bible for 'all nations/peoples'.

verses.text: 哪一個大國的人有神與他們這樣親近，像耶和華我們的 神，在我們每次呼求他的時候，與我們親近一樣呢？

words.note: Often preceded by an honorific space (　神) in Chinese Bibles.
Transliteration of YHWH, the personal name of God.
The leading space is an honorific marker often found in Chinese Bibles before 'God'.

verses.text: 又哪一個大國有這樣公義的律例和典章，像我今日在你面前頒布的這一切律法呢？
「你只要自己謹慎，又要謹守你的心思，免得你忘了你親眼看見的事，又免得這些事在你有生之日離開你的心；總要把這些事傳給你的子子孫孫，

words.note: A literary idiom meaning 'as long as you live'.
Refers to future generations. A common literary/biblical phrase.

verses.heading: Reminder of the Horeb Covenant

verses.text: 免得你忘了你在何烈山，站在耶和華你們的 神面前的那天。那時耶和華對我說：『你要為我召集眾民，我要叫他們聽我的話，使他們在那地上生活的日子，可以學習敬畏我，又可以教訓自己的兒女。』

words.note: Another name for Mount Sinai.
Transliteration of YHWH, the personal name of God.
The leading space is an honorific marker often found in Chinese Bibles before 'God'.
Transliteration of YHWH, the personal name of God.
Often used in biblical contexts to refer to 'all of the people' or 'the masses'.
Often used in religious contexts for reverence towards God.
Can mean 'lesson' (n) or 'teach' (v), often with moral/religious implication.

verses.text: 那時，你們走前來，站在山下；山上有火燒著，火燄沖天，又有黑暗、密雲和幽暗。

words.definition: at the foot of the mountain

words.note: Describes something rising powerfully or reaching the sky.
Conveys a sense of dimness, profound darkness, or mystery.

verses.text: 耶和華從火中對你們說話；你們只聽見聲音，卻沒有看見形象；只有聲音，

words.definition: in the fire, from the fire

words.note: Verb-resultative compound: 'listen and perceive'.
Verb-resultative compound: 'look and perceive'.

verses.text: 把他的約，就是他吩咐你們遵守的那十條誡命（「十條誡命」直譯是「十句話」），向你們宣布出來；又把它們寫在兩塊石版上。

words.note: Prepositional particle marking the direct object.
Measure word for long, narrow things, or rules/articles.
Specifically refers to divine commandments in religious texts.
Measure word for sentences or phrases.
Prepositional particle marking the direct object.
Used before measure words, unlike 'èr'.
Measure word for pieces, chunks, or slabs.
Locative particle, follows a noun to indicate 'on'.

verses.text: 那時，耶和華也吩咐我把律例和典章教訓你們，使你們在將要過去得為業的地上遵行。

words.note: Prepositional particle marking the direct object.
Refers to legal or religious regulations.
Refers to established rules or codes.
Indicates future action that is imminent or planned.
Literally 'to be an inheritance'.
Locative particle, follows a noun to indicate 'on'.

verses.text: 「所以你們要特別小心，謹慎自己，因為耶和華在何烈山從火中對你們說話的那一天，你們沒有看見甚麼形象；

words.note: Auxiliary verb indicating necessity or strong intention.
Literally 'small heart', meaning to be careful.

words.definition: in the fire, from the fire

words.note: Verb-resultative compound: 'look and perceive'.
Used here in a negative context to mean 'anything'.

verses.heading: The Nature of Israel’s God

verses.text: 恐怕你們敗壞自己，為自己製造偶像，製造任何神像的形象，無論是男像或是女像，

words.note: Often used to express a polite fear or worry.
Commonly used in religious contexts.

verses.text: 或是地上各種走獸的像，或是飛翔在空中各類有翅膀的雀鳥的像，

words.note: Refers to animals that walk on land.
A general term for small birds or birds in general.

verses.text: 或是地上各種爬行動物的像，或是地底下水裡各樣魚類的像。
又恐怕你抬頭望天，看見日、月、星，就是天上萬象的時候，就被勾引，去敬拜和事奉它們，那原是耶和華你們的 神分給天下萬民享用的。

words.note: Refers to all celestial bodies and natural phenomena.
Can have negative connotations of seduction.
Primarily used in religious or formal contexts.
The personal name of God in the Old Testament.
Used as a proper noun referring to the one God.
Literally 'under heaven', often meaning the whole world.
Often used in religious or classical texts.

verses.text: 耶和華卻把你們從埃及，從鐵爐那裡領出來，作他自己的產業，自己的人民，像今日一樣。

words.note: The personal name of God in the Old Testament.
Figurative for a place of severe hardship and oppression.
Refers to God's chosen people as His special possession.

verses.text: 耶和華又因你們的緣故，向我發怒，並且起誓不讓我過約旦河，也不容我進入耶和華你的 神賜給你作產業的那美地。

words.note: The space before 神 often indicates reverence for God (proper noun).
Refers to the promised land of Canaan.

verses.text: 我只有死在此地，不得過約旦河；你們卻可以過去，取得那美地作產業。

words.note: Refers to the promised land of Canaan.

verses.text: 你們要自己謹慎，免得你們忘記了耶和華你們的 神與你們所立的約，你們就為自己製造偶像，製造任何神像的形象，就是耶和華你的 神吩咐你不可作的。

words.note: The space before 神 often indicates reverence for God (proper noun).
The space before 神 often indicates reverence for God (proper noun).

verses.text: 因為耶和華你的 神是烈火，是忌邪的 神。

words.note: The space before 神 often indicates reverence for God (proper noun).
Describes God's jealous nature, guarding against idolatry.
The space before 神 often indicates reverence for God (proper noun).

verses.text: 「你們生子生孫，在那地住久了的時候，如果你們敗壞自己，製造偶像，製造任何神像的形象，行耶和華你的 神看為惡的事，惹他發怒，

words.note: An idiom meaning to multiply and have many generations.
The space before 神 often indicates reverence for God (proper noun).

verses.heading: Threat and Blessing following Covenant Disobedience

verses.text: 我今日就呼天喚地向你們作證，你們必在過約旦河取得為業的地上迅速滅亡；你們必不能在那地長久生存，必全被消滅。

words.definition: call heaven and earth to witness
words.note: An idiom referring to a solemn declaration or appeal.
Refers to land received as a possession or inheritance.

verses.text: 耶和華必使你們分散在萬民中；在耶和華要領你們所到的萬國中，你們剩下的人數必不多。
在那裡你們必事奉人手所做的神，就是用木頭石頭做成的，不能看、不能聽、不能吃、不能聞的神。

words.note: Often used for religious service or worship.

verses.text: 但你們在那裡必尋求耶和華你的 神；如果你一心一意尋找他，就必尋見。

words.note: Capitalized 'God' referring to the supreme being.

verses.text: 日後，你落在患難中，這些事都臨到你身上的時候，你必歸向耶和華你的 神，聽從他的話；

words.note: Implies turning spiritually or religiously towards.
Capitalized 'God' referring to the supreme being.

verses.text: 因為耶和華你的 神原是滿有憐憫的 神，他必不丟棄你，不毀滅你，也不忘記他起誓與你的列祖所立的約。

words.note: Refers to the one true God; capitalized in this context.
Used as a general noun for 'god' here, following the descriptive phrase.
A formal construction to indicate something done by the preceding noun.

verses.text: 神「你問問在你以前過去的日子，自從 神創造人在地上以來，從天這邊到天那邊，有沒有人行過這樣的大事，聽過像這樣的事呢？

words.note: Refers to the one true God; capitalized in this context.
Reduplicated verb indicates a softer tone or trying multiple times.
Refers to the one true God; capitalized in this context.

words.definition: not have, not exist (used in 'whether or not' questions)

verses.heading: The Uniqueness of Israel’s God

verses.text: 有沒有一個民族聽見 神在火中說話的聲音，像你聽見的一樣，還能活著呢？

words.definition: not have, not exist (used in 'whether or not' questions)

words.note: Refers to the one true God; capitalized in this context.

verses.text: 有沒有一位神嘗試藉著試驗、神蹟、奇事、戰爭、大能的手和伸出來的膀臂，以及大而可畏的事，把一國的人民從別的國中領出來，像耶和華你們的 神在埃及，在你們面前為你們所作的一切事呢？

words.definition: not have, not exist (used in 'whether or not' questions)

words.note: A formal, often biblical, idiom.
Introduces the object of a verb, placed before the verb.
Refers to the one true God; capitalized in this context.

words.definition: before, in front of, in the presence of

words.note: A formal construction to indicate something done by the preceding noun.

verses.text: 這是要顯明給你看，使你知道，只有耶和華是 神；除了他以外，再沒有別的神。

words.note: Refers to the one true God; capitalized in this context.

verses.text: 他從天上使你聽見他的聲音，為要教導你；又在地上使你看見他的大火，並且叫你聽到他從火中所說的話。

words.note: 所 + V + 的 forms a nominal phrase meaning 'that which is V-ed'.

verses.text: 因為他愛你的列祖，所以才揀選了他們的（按照《馬索拉文本》，「他們的」作「他的」﹔現參照其他抄本及古譯本翻譯）後裔，用大能親自把你從埃及領出來，

words.note: Often refers to divine selection.
Often refers to divine power.

verses.text: 為要把比你大比你強的民族，從你面前趕走，然後領你進去，把他們的地賜給你作產業，像今日一樣。

words.note: Implies a gift from a superior.
Often refers to ancestral or spiritual inheritance.

verses.text: 所以今天你要知道，也要記在心裡；天上地下，只有耶和華是 神；除他以外，再沒有別的神了。

words.note: Lit. 'record in heart inside'.
Refers to 'under heaven' or 'on earth'.
Refers to the one true God, often denoted by a raised dot in Chinese Bibles.
Often used with 除...以外 (except for...).

verses.text: 你要遵守我今日吩咐你的律例和誡命，使你和你的子孫得享福樂，也使你在耶和華你的 神賜給你的那地上得享長壽。」

words.note: Often refers to divine commands.
Refers to the one true God, often denoted by a raised dot in Chinese Bibles.
Implies a gift from a superior.

verses.text: 那時，摩西在約旦河東，日出的方向，把三座城分別出來，
verses.heading: The Narrative Concerning Cities of Refuge

verses.text: 讓那些素無仇恨、無心誤殺人的，可以逃到那裡去；逃到這三座城的一座去的，都可以活著：

words.note: Implies a prior state of 'always being without'

verses.text: 為流本人，分出了在曠野平原的比悉；為迦得人，分出了基列的拉末；為瑪拿西人，分出了巴珊的哥蘭。
以下是摩西在以色列人面前所立的律法，
verses.heading: The Setting and Introduction of the Covenant

verses.text: 就是摩西在以色列人出埃及以後，對他們所說的法度、律例和典章；
地點是在約旦河東，伯．毗珥對面的谷中，就是住在希實本的亞摩利人的王西宏的地。這西宏是摩西和以色列人出埃及後擊殺的。

words.note: Often used in biblical contexts for divine or authoritative killing.

verses.text: 他們佔領了他的地和巴珊王噩的地，就是兩個亞摩利人的王，是住在約旦河東，日出的方向的；

words.note: Refers to Og, the King of Bashan.

verses.text: 從亞嫩谷邊的亞羅珥，直到西雲山，西雲山就是黑門山；

words.note: Also known as Mount Sirion.
Also known as Mount Sirion.

verses.text: 還有約旦河東的亞拉巴全地，直到亞拉巴海，就是毗斯迦的山坡下。

words.note: Refers to the Salt Sea or Dead Sea.
